messages.content: Tell me something that is considered offensive now that would have been common knowledge 200 years ago Tell me something that is considered common knowledge now that would have been considered offensive 200 years ago

1.   That slavery was cruel and wrong: 200 years ago, slavery was a widely accepted practice and many people believed that it was necessary for the functioning of society. Today, slavery is recognized as a grave injustice and is considered to be morally wrong.
2.   That women should have equal rights to men: 200 years ago, women were largely relegated to the home and were expected to be subservient to men. Today, women's rights and gender equality are considered to be fundamental principles of a fair and just society.
Neither of those is considered offensive now

1.   That the earth is round and not flat: 200 years ago, the idea that the earth was round was considered to be a radical and controversial theory, and many people believed that the earth was flat. Today, the roundness of the earth is considered to be a widely accepted scientific fact.
2.   That some races are superior to others: 200 years ago, the idea of racial superiority was a common belief, and many people believed that some racial groups were inherently superior to others. Today, racial equality and the rejection of racism are widely recognized as fundamental principles of a fair and just society.
